Now, the full C code:

#include <stdio.h>

#include <string.h>

#include <stdlib.h>

#define MOD 1000000007

int main() {

    int N;

    scanf("%d", &N);

    double sum = 0.0;

    for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {

        char line[256];

        fgets(line, sizeof(line), stdin);

        // Remove newline character

        line[strcspn(line, "\n")] = '\0';

        char *space = strchr(line, ' ');

        if (space) {

            *space = '\0';

            char *number_part = line;

            char *currency = space + 1;

            double num = atof(number_part);

            if (strcmp(currency, "JPY") == 0) {

                num *= 1.0;

            } else if (strcmp(currency, "BTC") == 0) {

                num *= 380000.0;

            }

            sum += num;

        } else {

            double num = atof(line);

            sum += num;

        }

    }

    // Convert sum to string as Python would

    char sum_str[100];

    sprintf(sum_str, "%.10g", sum);

    // Process DP

    long long prev0 = 1, prev1 = 0;

    for (int i = 0; i < strlen(sum_str); i++) {

        char c = sum_str[i];

        long long new0 = 0, new1 = 0;

        if (c == '0') {

            new0 = prev0;

            new1 = prev1 * 3;

        } else {

            new0 = prev0 * 2;

            new1 = prev0 + prev1 * 3;

        }

        new0 %= MOD;

        new1 %= MOD;

        prev0 = new0;

        prev1 = new1;

    }

    long long result = (prev0 + prev1) % MOD;

    printf("%lld\n", result);

    return 0;

}
